column1: Epispadias can occur with a rare birth defect called bladder exstrophy.
Epispadias can also occur with other birth defects.

Signs include: - Abnormal opening from the bladder neck to the area above the normal urethra opening - Backward flow of urine into the kidney (reflux nephropathy) - Urinary incontinence - Urinary tract infections - Widened pubic bone Tests may include: - Blood test - Intravenous pyelogram (IVP), a special x-ray of the kidneys, bladder, and ureters - MRI and CT scans, depending on the condition - Pelvic x-ray - Ultrasound of the urinary system and genitals
Surgery can help the person control the flow of urine.
Some people with this condition may continue to have urinary incontinence, even after surgery.
